enableCaching.description: Determines if the "cache-control" HTTP headers should be set and if conditional GET (304) requests should be supported. This could be helpful to disable while in development mode.

enableTagHelperBundling.description: Determines if `<script>` and `<link>` elements should point to the bundled path or a reference per source file should be created. This is helpful to disable when in development mode.

url.description: An absolute URL used as a prefix for static resources

prefetch.description: If true, injects a <link rel='dns-prefetch'> tag that speeds up DNS resolution to the CDN.

cacheId.description: The cache identifier of the service worker (can be any string). Change this property to force the service worker to reload in browsers.

offlineRoute.description: The route to the page to show when offline.

registerServiceWorker.description: Determines if a script that registers the service worker should be injected into the bottom of the HTML page.

registerWebmanifest.description: Determines if a meta tag that points to the web manifest should be inserted at the end of the head element.

routesToPreCache.description: A comma separated list of routes to pre-cache when service worker installs in the browser.

strategy.description: Selects one of the predefined service worker types.

ApiKey.description: An elmah.io API key with the Messages | Write permission.

LogId.description: The Id of the elmah.io log to store messages in.

Application.description: An application name to put on all error messages.

HandledStatusCodesToLog.description: A list of HTTP status codes (besides 404) to log even though no exception is thrown.

TreatLoggingAsBreadcrumbs.description: Include log messages from Microsoft.Extensions.Logging as breadcrumbs.

HeartbeatId.description: The Id of the elmah.io heartbeat to notify.

protocols.description: The protocols enabled on the endpoint.

Path.description: The certificate file path. If a file path is specified then the certificate will be loaded from the file system.

KeyPath.description: The certificate key file path. Available in .NET 5 and later.

Password.description: The certificate password used to access the private key.

Subject.description: The certificate subject. If a subject is specified then the certificate will be loaded from the certificate store.

Store.description: The certificate store name. Defaults to 'My'.

Location.description: The certificate store location. Defaults to 'CurrentUser'.

AllowInvalid.description: A value indicating whether or not to load certificates that are considered invalid. Defaults to false.

sslProtocols.description: Specifies allowable SSL protocols. Defaults to 'None' which allows the operating system to choose the best protocol to use, and to block protocols that are not secure. Unless your app has a specific reason not to, you should use this default. Available in .NET 5 and later.

clientCertificateMode.description: Specifies the client certificate requirements for a HTTPS connection. Defaults to 'NoCertificate'. Available in .NET 5 and later.

Endpoints.title: endpoints
Endpoints.description: Endpoints that Kestrel listens to for network requests. Each endpoint has a name specified by its JSON property name.

Url.description: The scheme, host name, and port the endpoint will listen on. A Url is required.

Sni.title: SNI
Sni.description: Server Name Indication (SNI) configuration. This enables the mapping of client requested host names to certificates and other TLS settings. Wildcard names prefixed with '*.', as well as a top level '*' are supported. Available in .NET 5 and later.

EndpointDefaults.title: endpoint defaults
EndpointDefaults.description: Default configuration applied to all endpoints. Named endpoint specific configuration overrides defaults.

Certificates.title: certificates
Certificates.description: Certificates that Kestrel uses with HTTPS endpoints. Each certificate has a name specified by its JSON property name. The 'Default' certificate is used by HTTPS endpoints that haven't specified a certificate.

logLevel.title: logging level options
logLevel.description: Log level configurations used when creating logs. Only logs that exceeds its matching log level will be enabled. Each log level configuration has a category specified by its JSON property name. For more information about configuring log levels, see https://docs.microsoft.com/aspnet/core/fundamentals/logging/#configure-logging.

FormatterName.description: Name of the log message formatter to use. Defaults to 'simple'.

FormatterOptions.title: formatter options
FormatterOptions.description: Log message formatter options. Additional properties are available on the options depending on the configured formatter. The formatter is specified by FormatterName.

IncludeScopes.description: Include scopes when true. Defaults to false.

TimestampFormat.description: Format string used to format timestamp in logging messages. Defaults to null.

UseUtcTimestamp.description: Indication whether or not UTC timezone should be used to for timestamps in logging messages. Defaults to false.

LogToStandardErrorThreshold.description: The minimum level of messages are written to Console.Error.

additionalProperties.title: provider logging settings
additionalProperties.description: Logging configuration for a provider. The provider name must match the configuration's JSON property property name.

allowedHosts.description: ASP.NET Core host filtering middleware configuration. Allowed hosts is a semicolon-delimited list of host names without port numbers. Requests without a matching host name will be refused. Host names may be prefixed with a '*.' wildcard, or use '*' to allow all hosts.

connectionStrings.title: connection string options
connectionStrings.description: Connection string configuration. Get connection strings with the IConfiguration.GetConnectionString(string) extension method.

additionalProperties.description: Connection string configuration. Each connection string has a name specified by its JSON property name.

autoReload.description: Automatically reload the NLog configuration when notified that appsettings.json file has changed.

throwConfigExceptions.description: Throws an exception when there is a config error? If not set, then throwExceptions will be used for this setting.

throwExceptions.description: Throws an exception when there is an error. For unit testing only and advanced troubleshooting.

internalLogLevel.description: The minimal log level for the internal logger.

internalLogFile.description: Write internal log to the specified filepath

internalLogToConsole.description: Write internal log to a console

internalLogToConsoleError.description: Write internal log to a console with error stream

globalThreshold.description: Log events below this threshold are not logged.

autoShutdown.description: Automatically call `LogFactory.Shutdown` on AppDomain.Unload or AppDomain.ProcessExit

extensions.description: Load NLog extension packages for additional targets and layouts

assembly.description: Assembly Name of the NLog extension package.

prefix.description: Appends prefix to all type-names loaded from the assembly

assemblyFile.description: Absolute filepath to the Assembly-file of the NLog extension package.

targetDefaultWrapper.title: default wrapper
targetDefaultWrapper.description: Wrap all defined targets with this custom target wrapper.

async.description: Wrap all defined targets using AsyncWrapper with OverflowAction=Discard for better performance.

NLogRulesItem.title: NLog rule item
NLogRulesItem.description: Redirect LogEvents from matching Logger objects to specified targets

logger.description: Match Logger objects based on their Logger-name. Can use wildcard characters ('*' or '?').

ruleName.description: Rule identifier to allow rule lookup with Configuration.FindRuleByName and Configuration.RemoveRuleByName.

levels.description: Comma separated list of levels that this rule matches.

writeTo.description: Name or names of a target - separated by comma. Remove this property for sending events to the blackhole.

final.description: Ignore further rules if this one matches.

action.description: Result action when filter matches logevent.

filterDefaultAction.description: Default action if none of the filters match.

$schema.title: Schema
$schema.description: Pointer to the schema against which this document should be validated.

Using.title: List of Auto-discovery of configuration assemblies
Using.description: Using section contains list of assemblies in which configuration methods. Can be required depending of the project type: See: https://github.com/serilog/serilog-settings-configuration#using-section-and-auto-discovery-of-configuration-assemblies

MinimumLevel.title: Minimum LogLevel Threshold
MinimumLevel.description: Minimum LogLevel Threshold. (Support dynamic reload if the underlying IConfigurationProvider supports it)

Properties.title: Log events Properties
Properties.description: This section defines a static list of key-value pairs that will enrich log events.

Enrich.title: Log events Enriches
Enrich.description: This section defines Enriches that will be applied to log events.

Filter.title: Log events filters
Filter.description: This section defines filters that will be applied to log events.

WriteTo.title: Configuration for log destination
WriteTo.description: This section configures the sinks that log events will be emitted to.

AuditTo.title: Configuration for log destination for auditing
AuditTo.description: This section configures sinks for auditing, instead of regular (safe) logging. Obs: When auditing is used, exceptions from sinks and any intermediate filters propagate back to the caller.

^Enrich:((?\u003CEnvironmentVariableName.title: Log events Enriches
^Enrich:((?\u003CEnvironmentVariableName.description: This section defines Enriches that will be applied to log events.

^Filter:((?\u003CEnvironmentVariableName.title: Log events filters
^Filter:((?\u003CEnvironmentVariableName.description: This section defines filters that will be applied to log events.

^WriteTo:((?\u003CEnvironmentVariableNam.title: Configuration for log destination
^WriteTo:((?\u003CEnvironmentVariableNam.description: This section configures the sinks that log events will be emitted to.

^AuditTo:((?\u003CEnvironmentVariableNam.title: Configuration for log destination for auditing
^AuditTo:((?\u003CEnvironmentVariableNam.description: This section configures sinks for auditing, instead of regular (safe) logging. Obs: When auditing is used, exceptions from sinks and any intermediate filters propagate back to the caller.

SerilogLogLevelThreshold.title: Log Level or LevelSwitches name
SerilogLogLevelThreshold.description: A Serilog Log Level or a reference to a Log Level Switch name on `LevelSwitches` configuration.

DetailedMinimumLevel.title: Detailed Log level.
DetailedMinimumLevel.description: Detailed Log level threshold object. Allowing set log levels be overridden per logging source.

Override.title: Logging Source Log level object.
Override.description: Set the Log level threshold or LevelSwitcher reference per Logging Source.

AssemblyReference.title: Assembly Name
AssemblyReference.description: .NET Assembly Name, without the file extension

CSharpMethodName.title: Method Name
CSharpMethodName.description: A name referring to a C# Class method

CSharpMethodArgumentName.title: Argument Name
CSharpMethodArgumentName.description: A name referring to a C# Class method argument

EnvironmentVariableName.title: Environment Variable Name
EnvironmentVariableName.description: A name referring to a OS Environment Variable

SerilogLevelSwitcherName.title: A Level Switcher Name
SerilogLevelSwitcherName.description: A name referring to a Serilog Settings Configuration Level Switcher

AWS.description: Settings for configuring the AWS SDK for .NET

AllowAutoRedirect.description: This flag controls if .NET HTTP infrastructure should follow redirection responses (e.g. HTTP 307 - temporary redirect).

AuthenticationRegion.description: Overrides the region used when computing AWS signature.

AuthSchemePreference.description: List of preferred authentication schemes in priority order.

BufferSize.description: The BufferSize controls the buffer used to read in from input streams and write out to the request.

ClientAppId.description: ClientAppId is an optional application specific identifier that can be set. When set it will be appended to the User-Agent header of every request in the form of app/{ClientAppId}.

ConnectTimeout.description: The ConnectTimeout property controls the timeout when establishing a connection. The units for the property is milliseconds

DefaultsMode.description: Sets the mode that SDK should use when setting default values for settings.

DisableHostPrefixInjection.description: Host prefix injection prefixes the service endpoint with request members from APIs which use this feature.

DisableLogging.description: If true logging for this client will be disabled.

DisableRequestCompression.description: Controls whether request payloads are automatically compressed for supported operations.

EndpointDiscoveryCacheLimit.description: The maximum number of discovered endpoints that can be stored within the cache for the client.

EndpointDiscoveryEnabled.description: The flag indicating if endpoint discovery should be enabled or disabled for operations that are not required to use endpoint discovery.

FastFailRequests.description: Under Adaptive retry mode the SDK will use fail fast logic.

HttpClientCacheSize.description: Controls the number of HttpClients cached for service clients.

IgnoreConfiguredEndpointUrls.description: If set to true the SDK will ignore the configured endpointUrls in the config file or in the environment variables.

LogMetrics.description: Flag on whether to log metrics for service calls.

LogResponse.description: If this property is set to true, the service response is logged.

MaxConnectionsPerServer.description: This property is used to set the MaxConnectionsPerServer on the matching property on the underlying HttpClient to make service calls.

MaxErrorRetry.description: How many retry HTTP requests an SDK should make for a single SDK operation invocation before giving up.

MaxStaleConnectionRetries.description: Maximum number of times the SDK will retry requests that fail due to stale pooled HTTP connections.

Profile.description: The AWS credential profiles the service client should be configured for.

ProfilesLocation.description: The path to where the AWS credential profile is configured. By default this is configured at ~/.aws/credentials.

ProgressUpdateInterval.description: The interval at which progress update events are raised for upload operations.

Region.description: The AWS region the service client should be configured for.

RequestMinCompressionSizeBytes.description: Minimum size in bytes that a request body should be to trigger compression.

ResignRetries.description: Flag on whether to resign requests on retry or not.

RetryMode.description: The current mode in use for request retries and influences the value returned from MaxErrorRetry.

ServiceURL.description: Overrides the region for the service clients and sends requests to the indicated url.

SessionName.description: The session name for the assumed session using the SessionRoleArn.

SessionRoleArn.description: If set this role will be assumed using the resolved AWS credentials.

SigV4aSigningRegionSet.description: List of AWS regions for SigV4a multi-region signing.

ThrottleRetries.description: Enables the SDK to use intelligent throttle retry logic.

Timeout.description: The timeout that is set on the HttpClient Timeout for configuring the wait time for requests time out.

UseAlternateUserAgentHeader.description: If true the service client will use the x-amz-user-agent header instead of the User-Agent header to report version and environment information to the AWS service. This is commonly used in Blazor WebAssembly applications.

UseDualstackEndpoint.description: Configures the endpoint calculation for a service to go to a dual stack (ipv6 enabled) endpoint for the configured region.

UseFIPSEndpoint.description: Configures the endpoint calculation to go to a FIPS endpoint for the configured region.

UseHttp.description: If true clients will attempt to use HTTP protocol if the target endpoint supports it.

title: JSON schema ASP.NET Core's appsettings.json file
